lines.text: It's not tipping I believe in. It's overtipping.
Are you trying to say capeesh?
Yeah.
Well don't do it, cause it hurts my ears when you do it
[Pickup line]
You know, it's dangerous for you to be here in the frozen food section.
Why is that?
Because you could melt all this stuff.

Richie loved to use 22s because the bullets are small and they don't come out the other end like a 45, see, a 45 will blow a barn door out the back of your head and there's a lot of dry cleaning involved, but a 22 will just rattle around like Pac-Man until you're dead.
[Barney tells a joke. Everyone laughs, except Hannah]
I see that it's funny. I have a sense of humor.
Of course you have a sense of humor. Everyone thinks they do, even people who don't.
[Vincent Antonelli is questioned about the stolen goods in the trunk of the car he stole]
The books...
You have something against books?
I have nothing about books! I am curious about the books in your trunk.
You see, I was thinking of writing my story, so I bought this one on how to do it.
Why do you need 25 copies of it?
In case I want to read it more than once...
Arugula. I haven't had arugula in six weeks.
What's that?
It's a vegetable.
The shoes, right? The shoes are tragic.

5 o'clock Christmas morning, I run downstairs and look under the tree and what do I find? Uncle Alfresco, dead on the floor, shot through the back of the head. Plus no bicycle. It was a disappointing Christmas on many levels.
Hello sir, would you like to try a vanilla-bran oat crunchy?
What do you think?
I never touched a gun in my life. That and that alone forever doomed me to middle management.

[trying to blackmail Hannah]
How's the turtle Mrs. Stubbs? Did your kids ever figure out you switched turtles on them because I know it would be a major disappointment for the to find out.
Barney, look at the way you eat pancakes!
How does he eat pancakes?
He has a system for eating pancakes.
So the bottom pancake gets the same amount of syrup as the first.
He has a system for *everything*!
Ehh, she's not my type. I like 'em... I dunno, kinda dirty or something.
Two double scotches please.
I'm sorry we can only serve two drinks at a time. Two double scotches would be four drinks.

OK how about this? You sell me my double scotch, and you sell my friend his double scotch, but instead of putting his double scotch on his tray, you put it on mine and I'll pay you for both. By the way have I told you that you look lovely in red and blue... Pam.
Ok, fine. Here you go.
Keep the change.
Oh, we're not allowed to accept tips.

[Turns to Barney]
Not allowed to accept tips.
You dirty rat!
Snitch!
Stool pigeon!
Informer!
Squealer!
You dirty rat!
I already said you dirty rat!
Yeah, but I say it better.
[Vinnie palms off a $100 bill to Barney]
You don't tip FBI men!
Sure you do!
I am the worst case scenario of Thomas Jefferson's dream.
What a day for a mow eh?
When did your wife leave?
October.
That's when my wife left! What is it about the month of October?
I dunno. The pressure of Halloween? You never know what to go as!

[into telephone]
Yes, I'd like a cab please at, ah...
[to Vinnie]
What the frig is the address here?
How should I know? Number One, Happy Street!
The Padres play the Mets every so often, though you folks would probably be Yankees fans. It's been my experience that most organized crime people are.
I love the Yankees, Linda loves the Yankees, so does Terry.
Who's Terry?
You are.
I thought you were dead.
That was the general idea.
Your honor, are we to believe that this man is in danger? That some cartoon character men in black suits with white on white ties armed with guns are going to walk through that door as we...

[two men enter the court, in black suits with white on white ties pulling out guns]
DUCK!
I'm sorry Barney but it's just not fun here. You're no fun!
No fun?
You get the oil changed every second Tuesday, you get the car washed every fourth Thursday, you get your hair cut on the eleventh of every month. You never, ever get a different haircut!
And where did you learn to jump start a car?
I learned it in the army.
Have a nice day.
Fuck you!
[last lines]
You know, sometimes I even amaze myself.
It's gonna be a lot easier if you two start calling each other Terry and Todd.
It's a nice house, Terry, okay?
No, you're Terry, he's Todd.
[Supervising his Mafia friends laying down sod for a baseball field]
Green side up, fellas! Green side up!
Would you care to bet on that?
I never bet when I'm sure and right.
Presumably you haven't done a lot of betting considering you've only been wrong once in your life.

[glaring at Barney]
Twice.
